t: Lamentations 5
Prayer for Restoration
Lord,*spn remember what has happened to us. Look,*ln and see our disgrace!
Our*ln inheritance has been turned over to strangers, our*ln houses to foreigners.
We*ln have become orphans, fatherless; our*ln mothers are widows.
We*ln must pay for the water we drink; our*ln wood comes at a price.
We*ln are closely pursued; we*ln are tired, and no one offers us rest.
We*ln made a treaty with Egypt and*ln with Assyria, to get enough food.
Our*ln ancestors sinned; they no longer exist, but*ln we bear their punishment.
Slaves*ln rule over us; no*ln one rescues us from them.
We*ln secure our food at the risk of our lives because*ln of the sword in the wilderness.
Our*ln skin is as hot as an oven from*ln the ravages of hunger.
Women*ln have been raped in Zion, virgins*ln in the cities of Judah.
Princes*ln have been hung up by their hands; elders*ln are shown no respect.
Young*ln men labor at millstones; boys*ln stumble under loads of wood.
The*ln elders have left the city gate, the*ln young men, their music.
Joy*ln has left our hearts; our*ln dancing has turned to mourning.
The*ln crown has fallen from our head. Woe*ln to us, for we have sinned.
Because*ln of this, our heart is sick; because*ln of these, our eyes grow dim:
because*ln of Mount Zion, which lies desolate and*ln has jackals prowling in it.
You,*ln Lord,*s are enthroned forever; your*ln throne endures from generation to generation.
Why*ln do you continually forget us, abandon*ln us for our entire lives?
Lord,*sln bring us back to yourself, so we may return; renew*ln our days as in former times,
unless*ln you have completely rejected us and*ln are intensely angry with us.
